Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not sure if it deserves the award”
Reviews.Author: SurajShah
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the award it has received from Tripadvisor. Not sure what it is based on. We had a superior room so it was adequately appointed but had a crap view. There are no other areas except for the breakfast area and the overly expensive spa so not sure what this award is based on. We had requested twin beds and even called Expedia who confirmed a Superior Room with twin beds but got one with a small double bed. Of course the staff were least bothered to change the room for us. Lesson learnt: NEVER BOOK WITH EXPEDIA! The staff are friendly on the surface, but are not proactive. It took 3 complaints for them to fix the airconditioning. For the same amount of money the Richmond on Istiklal Street is much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “sguep”
Reviews.Author: Marco G
Reviews.Content: We stayes 5 nights in room 412. The room is very nice and comfortable. A little noisy, but we had no great problems. Bathroom is clean. Beakfast is really excellent (delicious oranges). Staff is polite, very professional, but it would be nice if some of the them gave you a smile sometimes. We loved staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous rooms”
Reviews.Author: FAlerhand
Reviews.Content: Stayed there four nights. Our room was beautiful, very little noise from outside. Service was delightful.The breakfast was also a great bargain. I would go back easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Carolynjane99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April - one night in a room at the back on the 3rd floor and 3 in 514 on the fifth. We moved rooms because the bathroom on the 3rd floor was too small. Rooms at the back are preferred as the front can be noisy. Room 514 was excellent; quirky but very comfortable. Lush has a nice vibe and is in a good location and I would have no problems recommending it. Breakfasts are excellent and the Dada bar downstairs is an oasis of tranquility just off the bustling Taksim square. Staff were really polite, pleasant and welcoming! Spa facilities are an added bonus. Loved it! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the heart of Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: Keremkpr
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have stayed in this wonderful hotel several times. The best thing about this hotel is that it is just 1min. walk to Taksim, which is one of the best places for both night life and sightseeing. Hotel is close to the subway station which connects to the other rail-ways, ferry lines and public transportation. They have professional and helpful stuff, nice breakfast and a nice restaurant which turns to a night club later. Lush Hotel has a unique character in decoration, every room has a different atmosphere. We have stayed in rooms 112, 301 and 305 and surely will taste the other rooms one by one. Don't care about the complaints about check out time in this site because the stuff is very respectful and they try to help you all the time and every hotel has a check out time. So this Hotel is one of the best choice, if you are planning to stay in the heart of Ä°stanbul in an area which never sleeps. It is also very clean, safe and without question it is worth for the money. Because the prices are reasonable for a hotel in this quality with one of the best location. Don't forget to check the holiday packages in special times like valentine's day or christmas time because they offer good packages for good money.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good staff, amazing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterash
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in a great area for sightseeing, restaurants and nightlife. Wooden floors in hallway however can be a bit noisy, I couldnt hear between rooms, but i could hear people walking through the hallways at times, this did not keep me from sleeping, but it was annoying in the mornings, while having a lie in etc. Breakfast was included in rate, but I never indulged, but friends that were staying said it was good for what it was. Great area with 24 stores and restaurants. Staff were very helpful and nothing was too much of a hassle for them. great stay overall. defintley would stay again, and would defineltey recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Bad communication”
Reviews.Author: FrankBeeblebrox
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but most of the staff is only really friendly to you, as long as they expect additional money from you. For example, we sent 3 emails prior to our trip to the hotel, but they only responded to the one in which we asked for the shuttle service. They ignored one email regarding our special room request and a second one regarding the question why they debited our credit card with 6 â‚¬ more than confirmed in a written form for the hotel room. As we asked them onsite about this additional amount, we have been told, that this is a matter of taxes. Nonsense. If you confirm an exact amount in a written form, thatÂ´s it. Chiara offered us much help.Thanks for this. Breakfast was a little boring after 4 nights, but the coffee was brilliant and the Orange Juice very taste. Much noise from the very busy street infront of the Hotel (Room #304).

Reviews.Title: “great service & staff”
Reviews.Author: Alice_b_gparis
Reviews.Content: They will really do anything to make your stay pleasant ! The breakfast is really nice (although the music playing is a bit loud...but that's just personal!), and the rooms are decorated with taste. And it's CLEAN!!! It does not look like all those big hotel chains with no soul and it is really appreciable. Of course the location is just ideal. Thank you Chiara and Beste, and all the Lush hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, staff & very important Location”
Reviews.Author: mytuppenceworth
Reviews.Content: Taxi driver has difficulty finding the place. It's is very near Taxcim square [nothing to write home about]. We got a really warm welcome for Chira. Automatically you feel good about the place. We got an upgrade from the standard room to what we told was the best room in the house [Elegance]. Thanks Chira!. Small elevator. Not wheelchair accessible. Luggage had to travel in a separate trip. Spacious room. Pillows & bed a little hard. Small point. Generally very very happy.. On hindsight should have packed togs & training gear. Hotel had sauna & fitness room. Last time we stayed in Istanbul we stayed in Sultanahmet [near to all the sights] but spent a lot of time in taxis going for dinner. Hence the move to Beyoglu on this occasion. I wanted to stay in Chingir, The hotel was 5 minutes walk away. I enjoy the dining experience, the hotel was nearly opposite Changa & a couple of metres from Mimonlett. I could not be more happy. Take a right when you leave the hotel, Head down the hill, Take the 2nd left after the hospital, 5 Kats will be on your right - great views at dusk from the 5th floor [Food only ok]. Rather keep heading down the hill to the 3 way junction. Take a left on Akarsu Caddesi & eat in Cafe Smyra. It will make you feel like your in Berlin. Mismatched shabby chic. Great steaks.. Another great visit to a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, value and location”
Reviews.Author: Goretex
Reviews.Content: The staff here made my stay very pleasant. From the moment I walked in and sat down, they offered me a drink and took care of everything. I asked a lot of questions at the front desk: sightseeing tips, restaurants, pubs, foods to try, transportation questions, etc., and the young lady assisting me, (although I understand she was actually one of the hotel management executives just filling in on the front desk) patiently helped me through all of my questions and concerns. All of the recommendations were spot on. My room, and in fact the whole hotel has a "cool" boutique decor and atmosphere. My room was not large but had everything that I needed (and an awesome shower). The location is great, just a couple of short blocks from Taksim Square and the main shopping street, and the price of the hotel was an incredible value. I'd say, "Look no further."

Reviews.Title: “Good, but can do better. Would give 3.5 if could.”
Reviews.Author: Mojourno79
Reviews.Content: Great decor and central location. Also friendly - was given a complimentary drink as soon as I got there. Having said that, I had booked a larger room, but was given a junior room instead. No refund for being given a cheaper room was offered, so I had to insist, and in the end I was given some money off the hotel cab back to the airport. The "junior" room is seriously small, and I wouldn't recommend it to couples with more luggage than a backpack. As a single room it was fine. Rooms facing the main street though are plagued by noise, at least on the Saturday night I stayed. On the plus side, the toiletries were great, from L'Occitane, and the breakfast buffet was also very good for this priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Troy60795
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was "five star". The front desk staff was plesant, kind and helpful with suggestions. They did great with suggestions for tours, dining and city attractions. The room was a little small and I would not suggest the extra money for a jr. suite but the staff was excellent. The breakfast was good and the restaurant was clean, again, the staff was super. Price was reasonable and the location was good in the Taskim area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel...awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: ParkMeadowsLodge
Reviews.Content: Picked-up this room on a hotels.com deal...was pleasantly surprised and would stay here again. Staff offered us a glass of wine upon arrival and were attentive until our departure. Don't hesitate to stay here - the neighborhood is as safe as anywhere else we were during our stay. (Swisshotel in Izmir, IC in Istanbul, etc...)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but bad neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Emre Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was great but Lush Hotel's neighborhood were wery bad. Cried the all night in front of the hotel. I had to call the police 3 times!

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: emily_hyl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my visit to Istanbul in Feb 2012. Overall the experience was very good. The front desk clerks are all very helpful and people who worked at the bar also provided very good service. The breakfast has many choices and the meals at the restaurant are also very good. The location is very central, walking distance to Taksim square and shopping street. Also there are many bars and shops around. I would definitely choose LUSH HOTEL again if I ever visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “I can not recommend this hotel because of bad service.”
Reviews.Author: davidiacus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located almost in the center of Istanbul. Stay close to such famous places as the Topkapi Palace and Suleymaniye Mosque. You can get there in a few minutes by public transport or on foot. The hotel provided me access to high-speed wireless Internet. The room was comfortable. Equipped with LCD TV was a lot of channels, safe and minibar. Unfortunately the hotel has some drawbacks. The first and most important is not the best service. One gets the impression that he was trying to force the tip! In addition, guests are not provided in almost any additional facilities outside the accommodation. Unfortunately I can not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, unique place”
Reviews.Author: helllooJordan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, unique hotel located near the bustling shopping district and some nice (though not expensive) restaurants. The staff was great. Breakfast was healthy and tasty. Only complaint was lack of privacy between the bathroom area and bedroom, but otherwise, it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel in busy Taksim area”
Reviews.Author: JEthanPan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very nice decors and close to Taksim busy shopping, clubs and restaurants. Highly recommended for someone likes boutique hotel instead of large chains.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, atypical in its concept”
Reviews.Author: W H
Reviews.Content: Nice and atypical hotel, far from those "industrial" hotels. The interior is fun and cozy. It is located near Taksim place, which permits us to experience the dynamic of the city. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is nice. I recommend this hotel and would go back with pleasure for my next trip in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, nice & clean modern apartment!”
Reviews.Author: MargitvN
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this appartment looks a little bit unsafe, but when opening the door to the reception, you will get a warm welcome. The room we stayed in was very clean and nicely decorated. You could see that a lot of effort was put into it. The furniture and facilities looked like they were brand new, and were very comfortable & clean. Diswasher, 2 bathrooms with showers, microwave, iron and wireless internet and TV. The bed was also very comfortable! Nothing bad can be sad about this aparment. We were staying here at NYE and although you can here some noise on the streets, it is not a major issue and it will not disturb you from sleeping...it is well isolated! Location of the apartment was also very good, nearby the square, only a 2 minute walk, and in the middle of the big shopping street! Metro station and taxi's/ buses are very close! If i come back to Istanbul i would definetely good back there, and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: MrSchiller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice when visiting Istanbul for work (it's been booked by others). Both times have been bad experiences. First time they had building-works throughout the hotel. Both the reception area and the breakfast room were construction sites. No one mentioned this, or even excused for the inconvenience. I had to leave at 05.00 in the morning to the airport and requested to settle my bill the evening before. They just said "no, impossible". I asked why, man in reception replied "because thats not how we do it here". The checkout the next morning took 30 minutes and they couldn't even provide an invoice. They said they would email it. They didn't. I have booked deluxe rooms. Cramped, No bed-lights, windows leading to a wall and ventilation-system, extremely hot and no way to get air in, nowhere to put the suit-case, etc. I tried to contact the hotel for airport pickup, they didn't reply to my first 3 emails. The location is really good, only reason to stay here. I liked the breakfast (the second time, when they had a breakfast-room).

Reviews.Title: “Better than 'just a good hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Patrick K
Reviews.Content: At this moment we're spending our last night at the Lush hotel. Looking at the past days of our 7 day visit, I expect nothing to influence my judgment negatively, so that's why I'm writing the review yet now :) At our midnight arrival the manager on duty informed us about a room upgrade. Lush never dissapointed us after that anymore: perfect location for us(near shops, gay club, good local restaurants). De staff was ever so friendly and the upgraded room was of a high standard. De breakfast buffet in restaurant Dada(in the same building) was perfect as well: modernly decorated, friendly staff and even until 'closing time of the buffet': fresh and complete.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with its own style”
Reviews.Author: Jordan_Travel_Guide
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay. Nice room designs. Location is the best thing close to Istiklal street and nightlife. Friendly staff. This is the place if you choose a different experience. Make sure you choose the right room. All rooms are different. A little bit over priced. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “"Feel good"”
Reviews.Author: Belti_11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which is locatted idealy for travellers. Excellent hotel support and facilities nearby! Would choose to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “great find, definitely would recommend”
Reviews.Author: tt2231
Reviews.Content: Lush Hotel is just what it advertises itself to be--a great cosmopolitan boutique hotel. All the rooms are different, but aim for modern urban design. If you have appreciation for this sort of establishment and enjoy urban living, this is the place for you. If you were looking for a budget American Hilton-hotel option, yes, you may be disappointed by its scale and maybe should look for the big name hotels by the river...but for those used to NYC boutique hotels, e.g., it will seem quite large (get the drift?). Also, we asked for our room to be at the top of the hotel, in order to have some distance from street level noise. There, on the top/5th floor the rooms are smaller and the ceiling won't be as high, but we thought our room was still spacious enough with clean, modern features and comfort. The rooms on the floors below are significantly larger and have loft height ceilings. Previous posts may have mentioned a loud club, but that was not at all the case during our stay--the bar was quiet and civilized. The hotel itself is clean, chic, and has friendly staff that go out of their way to be helpful. The two best features about this hotel aside from affordable price relative to design features and amenities (rainforest shower heads, flat screen HDTV, free wifi, l'occitane products, etc) are: 1) Central location for experiencing the city--it is within a less than 5 min walk to the Taksim square subway stop and is only one block over from the big shopping street Istiklal Caddesi. With many of Beyoglu's great cafes and restaurants in walking distance. At the same time, it's tucked away enough to be not too noisy (at least not from our top floor hotel room facing the back) 2) Great breakfast buffet--the daily buffet includes delicious fresh fruit and a selection of tasty Turkish cheeses and breads, as well as a rotating variety of warm egg and starch dishes, among others. In this town, there are certainly a good number of nice boutique hotels, but many are quite expensive. Lush Hotel exceeded our expectations and was a great oasis for recharging in a bustling city. We will definitely come back. .

Reviews.Title: “Very kind staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: morh
Reviews.Content: Several time I has been in Istanbul and like always I prefere to have the Hotel in Taksim square. The location of Lush Hotel is that I looked for; it's very close to Taksim square and to Istiklal Caddesi, the hearth of shopping in Istanbul. The staff is very kind and available. The breakfast is good and also the breakfast time is up to 11 am. Surely I will back in this Hotel at the next visit of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Philip D
Reviews.Content: Super hotel - close to where ever you need to be, clean smart rooms. The best though is the supurb hospitality. I felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ASG
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, having transferred from a conference hotel further out of the centre. The location of Lush couldn't be better. We had a great welcome from the staff who really were very kind and helpful. I had read previous reviews about the noise so asked for a quiet room. We stayed on a Friday night but really weren't disturbed by the noise of the bar below. We were on the fourth floor which probably helped a lot. The room is small but the decor is fun and the toiletries (L'Occitaine) were an additional treat. The bed was ok, not great, but acceptable. They could do with installing some kind of black out system, since the blinds were pretty but not very functional. There were lots of routers on the various floors but Wifi didn't reach our room. I am sure that this is a problem that they are trying to resolve. Breakfast was plentiful and good. We had to check out one day early because of problems at home, but there was no extra charge made for this. To sum up, it is a fun place to stay and in a great location with excellent service. It's not an average business hotel but it doesn't sell itself to be that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel In Taksim Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Babake
Reviews.Content: Best blind choice of hotel I have made in years. Friendly and helpful staff managing a well priced and easily accessible facility. I will recommend it without hesitation to businessmen and couples travelling without kids older than 3-4 years. Families wishing to savor the Lush treatment might have to take the Lush Apartments in another part of the city. Management should fix / upgrade the wifi!

Reviews.Title: “lush hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamdbLondon
Reviews.Content: very friendly, nice interior, great location, but expensive

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy and very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: daniyah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. In a good location but the room was very small, and you could hear the person in the room next door pee!! The bed was extremely uncomfortable and bedding very poor. Staff very friendly. Wifi did not work in the rooms so had to come to reception to connect. I do not plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lush hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lush Hotel twice on our recent trip to Turkey, for 5 nights each time. The location near Taksim Square is very good for transportation and restaurants. The hotel is well run and well maintained, and the breakfasts were excellent, the best we had in Turkey (all were good). The staff went out of their way to help us, even though they were very busy. Book ahead; Istanbul is a popular spot for conferences as well as for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy and was double-charged for my room”
Reviews.Author: HLC_11
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location of Lush Hotel is great and the room very comfortable, the noise level was the worst I have ever experienced in a hotel. My room (room 101) overlooked the courtyard to the hotel club/bar/restaurant. From 10pm every evening until around 3am, the music coming from the bar was so loud it felt like my bed was actually in the club/bar! To add insult to injury, the hotel refused to honour my prepaid hotel voucher on checkout (booked through Agoda) and, whilst they have since acknowledged this was an error and had assured me they would refund me, have failed to refund me for the 5 nights bed and breakfast they have now been paid twice for (this was 3 weeks ago now). Do not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it - Loud and Sterile”
Reviews.Author: KimDenverTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and then insisted that our travel company move us to another hotel. The hotel is trying to be "boutique" but doesn't quite get the concept. The room was miniscule and stripped down and very "tired." It felt like a college dorm with hand-me-down Ikea furniture. Paint was chipped, wallpaper peeling. Room just felt sterile and dirty. The hallways smelled like a sewer. There was a disco music blasting from their downstairs club all night and into the morning. It was still going strong at 3:30 am. Even though we booked a double, they gave us one cup and one mug and one towel and a total of two pillows (that were about a quarter of an inch thick).

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is tiny and tired and the rooms no better;'hip' apparently translates to noisy night club in the basement”
Reviews.Author: janniefr
Reviews.Content: The lobby looked like it had a hangover - mirrors on the walls were dirty, there was barely a place for the 4 of us to sit as we waited to check in, the chairs were old with broken springs. Our rooms weren't ready and they didn't even bother to send us to their dining room downstairs so we could be comfortable and get a cup of tea. After asking about when they would be ready, we left to exchange money; when we returned they told us our rooms were ready but I arrived to find the maid in our room and pissed off (at us? at front desk?) that we had been sent up. Maid called downstairs but no one came up to apologize or ask us down for a cup of tea. We spent another 15 minutes waiting in the hall with the luggage we brought up. We got junior rooms which were so small there wasn't a place to put anything larger than a 22" carry on. Its nearly false advertising, as the first room displayed on the junior room page is much bigger than all the others. The walls were painted white and all scuffed up. A soda can was left under our bed. Our friends room had mold on the bathroom walls. The bathroom light was on the outside wall, but behind the door when you opened it. The bedroom lights turned on with a tiny easily lost remote control - imagine looking for that when you are up at 5am to catch your plane. The music from the disco pounded all night and when we went to breakfast the same beat was pounding at volume that made breakfast unbearable. There was nothing to drink (water or juice) on the breakfast bar and no service to be found. Other rooms appear beautiful, but when we were offered an upgrade we opted to have our travel agent find us another hotel (on the old side) for the the remainder of our stay. Even at the junior room prices, this place was a poor value. I can't imagine staying in a larger , more expensive room and hearing that club music all night. The Lush appears to be a hotel that prefers to be a club.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great Location, very friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “More negative than positive”
Reviews.Author: morse3148
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here along with our friends (2 other couples) just last week. We booked 3 rooms at the same time (months ago) and were told they were the same type and price. The 3 rooms, 101, 102 and 201 overlooked the cafe/garden by day but it turned into a dinner spot and somewhat of a nightclub in the evening. I'm not a room snob, so when we checked in for our 4 nights I took their word that the "Elegance" rooms we all had were the same. I realized after the first noisy night that this was not so. Our room, 102, was about half the size, with only a queen bed in contrast to our friends with big rooms, king beds and comfortable chairs to read in. Our only chair was a really small,uncomfortable desk chair. All of us experienced the noise of the cafe, which on Fri and Sat nights seems to turn into a nightclub and the music blares until 1 or 2* am. About 6:30 am on the morning after our first night, the taped music came on at the same volume as it was the previous night, same singer too. I suspect one of the breakfast room staff arrived and turned it on perhaps accidentally, but it lasted for a good 10 minutes and enough to fully wake us up. Okay, here's the problem with all this. 1. Room 102 is inferior to 101 and 201 regardless of what label you attach to it. When I pointed this out to the guest relations manager, Chiara, all she could say was "they are all Elegance Rooms". I suggested she go look at 102 and then explain to me how it can be priced the same given the room and bed size. She seemed to be too stressed out to comprehend what I was saying and gave only a robot response. 2. When I told reception staff about the music coming on at 6:30 am.....their response was that this could not have happened. So, the guest is a liar? Not a good way to handle things. 3. After 2 nights, we asked for a room change.....were offered and took 411 overlooking the street and supposedly a lesser room. Well, it was larger, had 3 big windows with a lovely view of Takism Square, bathroom twice as big as 102 and yes there was street noise, but earplugs cured that problem. How they rate their rooms is a complete mystery. 4. Reception staff were often not very friendly overall and somewhat indifferent to guests. This may be a "hip" hotel, but the guests we saw were mostly not "hippsters" and I suspect there is a bit of disconect between guest experiences and Lush's trying to have both a 4 star hotel over a noisy cafe/night club. Lush needs to pick what it wants to be. 5. Breakfast food was overall pretty good. Staff service was awful. Every morning I had to hunt down staff to ask for coffee or orange juice. No one ever tried to serve me. Most mornings staff appeared to be arguing about something among themselves and paying little attention to guests. Lastly, when we arrived, Chiara informed us she responded to every Trip Advisor comment. Perhaps she should spend a lot less time on that effort and instead focus on developing Lush's potential to be a really great hotel. Right now the many good qualities of this property and it's potential are crushed by the odd attitude of its staff and the conflict over cafe/nightclub versus good hotel. I would not recommend the Lush Hotel as there are many others offering more value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Spot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cameron C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this new and growing hotel. Our rooms were comfortable and very, very clean. A beautifully decorated, trendy hotel in a very active and fun part of Istanbul. The staff was so nice and very helpful. The restaurant and bar downstairs are wonderful and, aside from a couple of tragically hip waitstaff who were out to lunch, they were outstanding. Great breakfast! (Halil was our favorite waiter!) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would enjoy the combination of the latest in hotel design and a centuries old neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “tres bon hotel”
Reviews.Author: simiindus
Reviews.Content: Good location - just a short walk to Istiklal St. Room was clean. Breakfast was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tacomaboy
Reviews.Content: Good location - just a short walk to Istiklal St. Room was clean. Mine was small, but quiet. There was no view, but it looks like there are fancier rooms available. Breakfast was outstanding - nice variety of fresh fruits, regional cheeses, yummy egg scramble. Bar with urban garden setting was cool. Staff was helpful - bartender directed me to the 360 Restaurant when I asked for someplace to go with a city view and I was pleased when I got there, check it out. Wish I would have more than an overnight stay. Will choose Lush again the enxt time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot to visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bitterkoekje
Reviews.Content: Visited Instanbul with a friend. The Lush Hotel is an excellent spot for a city trip. Right in the middle of the city, very nearby various histric areas of Istanbul as well places to wine, dine and relax. Room was very good, very relax place to enjoy the breakfast, and drinks. Personnel was even more then excellent. Very friendly and willing to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WJBarnes
Reviews.Content: Nice hip hotel and right in the middle of the late night activities.. Great place..

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean hotel in hearth of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: saharn62
Reviews.Content: the hotel is placed in Taksim hearth of Istanbul city, the decoration is really unique , each room has a different look, the rooms are very clean although if you are staying in junior room you may find it small, the staff are friendly and will help you as much as possible. it is close to taksim region so you can enjoy nightlife in Istanbul without being worried about moving from one location to another

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended step away”
Reviews.Author: marwa_nawwar
Reviews.Content: soo bad in everything very very small rooms u cant even sleep or move inside it, its like a cage actually. receptionists are terrible and breakfast buffet was soo poor. the only good thing that its near from taksim square but my overall opinion its definitely not 4 star hotel its only one star. step away dont even think about it

Reviews.Title: “A very good pick in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Mistergooddeal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Lush Hotel and strongly recommend this hotel. It is very well located (next to Taksim square and all the trendy restaurants, bars and clubs of Beyoglu). The rooms are very pleasant and well decorated (though a bit small), and there is a lovely backyard / garden where the breakfast is served. Last but not least, Chiara, who is in charge of Guest Relations, is a really charming and helpful person!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, stylish and a touch noisy...just like Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: embo769
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Lush, arriving and leaving in the early morning thanks to cheap flights. The staff were friendly and helpful regardless of the time of day. Breakfast was a good if not expansive buffet taken in the lovely bar / courtyard area. Couldn't fault the room's decor and amenities, but we found the street outside to be very loud as you are 100m from Taksim square, which genuinely doesn't sleep. Taksim / Beyoglu district revolves around bars and restaurants so it's a short stagger back in the evenings. Most tourist sites (the old town including Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace and Haghia Sophia) are about 15 minutes by cheap tram, or a lengthy walk including 1 large hill; take the funicular railway on the way home. We'd stay there again, but request a room overlooking the rear courtyard for a better night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing breakfast, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: AKC1350
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lush for two days, and had a great experience. The neighborhood is much less touristy than Sultanahmet, and there are lots of great, authentic restaurants and fun bars nearby. The rooms are a little small, but the hotel is in a pretty old building with high ceilings, and the location is great. The evening delivery of lokum is a nice touch. Sauna and steam room were clean and well-maintained. Also, the free breakfast served in the downstairs bar/courtyard was the best we had had on our whole trip! We will definitely stay here again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for a stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Diederik D
Reviews.Content: The perfect spot for a stay in Istanbul, very friendly. During breakfast you can ask a charming lady all about Istanbul, where you can go of what you should see, very nice. Breakfast was good. Once we came at 03.00 am back in the hotel, was no problem to order a nice bottle of white wine in the bar, a very good and friendly service. The hotel is next to de Taksi place, one of the hotspots of Istanbul. A negative experience was the taxidriver who drove us back to the airport. (hotel arranged the taxidriver). This was real madness, the man drove 120km en was talking with an other taxidriver through the window, real dangerous. He drove much to fast, we we're glad when we arrived all right at the airport. So watch out with the taxidrivers!!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: christos60
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, highly recomendable. Strategically located with excellent facilities and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lush indeed”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Marc82
Reviews.Content: Nice mix of modern and traditional decor. A lot of staff there to assist and very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Darren K
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small. (as are a lot of hotel rooms in Taksim area) it was clean, comfortable and attractive with a very unique look. The staff in the hotel were superb. Very friendly and ready to offer advise and help with requests. The hotel is located in a great area just 2 minutes walk from the central Taksim monument. I have stayed in Istanbul many times for both business and tourism and this is the first time I have stayed in Lush Hotel. This will be my prefered hotel for my next visit. I would say it is ideal for singles, couples, groups and business, but not sure about for families.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel with lots of character - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: kw76
Reviews.Content: The room was basic but clean. I loved the fact it had a full size double bed (instead of two beds pushed together) and good quality bedding. The shower was full powered and there were high quality amenities in the bathrooms which I was very happy with. The staff were very helpful throughout my stay and did eveyrthing they could to make my saty as best as they could. The breakfast buffet was great and plentiful. They could make you omelettes, and other cooked breakfasts to order so nothing sitting out getting cold. For a business traveller, like myself, couldn't have been better. Good room, good breakfast and free internet. My only downpoint is that it is noisy due to street noise - car horns etc. but that's to do with staying in a central location rather than the hotel. If you want to stay anywhere central in Istanbul you need to take earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: AysuSchiavello
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spotless and bathrooms always perfectly cleaned. Decor uniquely Istanbul themed and spacious. Service was excellent and doorman even stopped traffic for us to get safely into a taxi accross the road for shopping in NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ± district! Literally meters away from the action in Taksim BeyoÄŸlu where there is an endless array of eating, drinking and shopping/entertainment choices. If you want to experience the real Istanbul in style this is the hotel for you! We were even assisted with our luggage during check in by a few famous Turkish soapie stars who frequently stay at this hotel :) Don't forget to visit the hotel bar 'Dada' for a pre-dinner cocktail it's authentic decor is very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: diggiducky
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Lush and had a terrific time and would come back any time. There are three main reasons: 1. Located next to Taksim means also in Istanbul's center. Walk out the door and be in the middle vibring life all day long. Many attraction are in walking distance, others are can be reached qucikly by taxi 2. All rooms have individal rooms and combine modern design with turkish flavors and design elements (for calibration: for business porposes I often stay at Park Hyatt, Ritz Carlton, etc.). 3. Staff is very friendly and supportive at any day and night time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast, but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Gazdoc999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and found the staff mostly pleasant and the breakfast was good. The room only had blinds, no curtains, so there was no way to make the room dark. In every other way, the room was fine, as was the bathroom. The street outside was busy to the early hours of the morning, the aircon worked well, but even with the windows closed there was some noise. I was very tired and slept well in the comfortable bed. Funnily enough, the most irritating thing was the minibar. It was only at checkout that I realised that the prices were in Euros for some reason (roughly doubling the prices). Also, standing at the checkout, with an airport bus to catch, is very annoying, when all the staff are doing is sending someone to check on whether you had one chocolate bar or two! The area is lively and close to all the night attractions, so many visitors will find the hotel matches their needs. Next time I would have the minibar emptied or locked for the duration of my stay. The WiFi did not reach my room either!

Reviews.Title: “A good-looking hotel with a case of style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Nadmer
Reviews.Content: We got off to a rocky start on our stay in Lush hotel, we'd read mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, but as we booked our holiday late we couldn't get the hotel we wanted and decided to stay at Lush. There was a mix up with our booking (perhaps equally the fault of Booking.com) in that my partner was to stay longer than me (for busines) and we had asked (in the comments section of the booking form) to be charged a lower room rate for the days he was going to stay alone. We rang the hotel the night before to double check this and they knew nothing of it, remitting us back to Booking.com - this game of tennis continued until we arrived the next day - the staff on reception were reluctant to resolve the problem and even got pretty defensive and told us it was a matter for us to resolve with Booking.com until we insisted that it was the hotel's job to read the booking form very firmly and they finally agreed to resolve it between themselves (which, thankfully they did, otherwise we would have changed hotels). Here is my review of the experience overall: 1. Service: reception can be a bit intimidating, as it's staffed by quite burly fashion-conscious guys, and you don't really get the impression they're there to help you (even though they're courteous) - when we asked for a map they asked if we wanted to buy their 5euro map! Service in the adjoining restaurant where breakfast is served is courteuos and quick with lovely decor. When we had a problem with the wifi (the fault of our cruddy laptop!), the 'IT manager' was incredibly sweet and helpful and did everything he could to solve the problem, even providing us with a USB modem. They also organised an airport transfer for us which was very convenient (35 euros at time of writing) but you need to ask for this as they don't automatically offer it. 2. The room: we knew the room was going to be tiny, so we were prepared for that (we got a junior double), though people used to bigger US-style hotel rooms may find this a shock. The design was stylish and modern though, as some reviewers have said in need of a lick of paint here and there - and we found some bare cables under our bed - not a good idea if you have babies! Lovely l'Occitane tolitries, though they were inconsistent about replacing them which seemed frankly stingy given the cost of the room - you got the impression the maids were going in and measuring how much shower gel you had used to see if you 'deserved' any more. Our double room also had just one robe, though I imagine they would have provided another if we had complained. A/C worked fine ans was needed form tiem to time. 3. The location: we had a room facing the side street rather than the main street, still there was some noise at night, though we are heavy sleepers and it didn't bother us much. I imagine a room on the main road would be pretty noisy. Very central for Istiklal Kaddessi shops, Taksim etc. 4. Breakfast: at first sight the buffet looked a bit sparse with usual Turkish fayre of yoghurts, cheeses, honey etc. BUT, on the tables there is a second cooked menu (which no-one really points out to you) with a selection of hot dishes (the eggs are particularly good) to choose from - these are generally delicious. Oranje juice is also great. Overall, I wouldn't 'not recommend' this hotel(we were not disapponted with our stay), but would say that it has enough so-so points to make it worth considering others in the area if they are available.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Marcel987
Reviews.Content: Lush has a good location for accessing Istanbul and the service and breakfasts were outstanding. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin R
Reviews.Content: Staff was great! My room had a view of a brick wall. Some rooms have good views, others don't. If this is important to you, clarify first. The rooms are generally very small, but nice. Each is decorated in a unique style. I went with a friend, he liked his room (ground floor). It was very nice. My room was one that seemed to be added to a blank space in the hotel after the fact, and I did not like the room I had. I think my room was the exception. There is a restaurant in the basement with a good breakfast and a bar for drinks in the evening. The location is perfect. Right there in the heart of Taksim Square. Price was reasonable, place was clean. I took a cab there and didn't inquire about parking, but it didn't look like there was much in the way of parking. If you are bringing a car, check first. Some reviews mentioned noise... No issues from my standpoint. Will I stay again? Yes, but I will be very particular about which room I get.

Reviews.Title: “Do you need sleep?”
Reviews.Author: Robwash
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks on our own traveling around Turkey. Started our trip in Istanbul at the Tom Tom Suites (great), and ended at the Lush Hotel for the last two nights (a Friday and Saturday). Let me get to the point. The ENTIRE BUILDING vibrates on Friday and Saturday night until about 6 AM. They turn the downstairs breakfast area into a club. I should have brought earplugs, but I am not sure they would have helped. Hey, the staff was polite. It was clean. Simple but nice design. Rooms were of decent size and the location was fine. My guess is that any other nights beside Friday and Saturday would be fine. But if you stay on those nights.....don't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in an old building - very nice”
Reviews.Author: columbus77
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms as such are very stylish. Every room is decorated individually. Location is great and 5min walk to Taksim square. Breakfast is as well good. Only the staff could be a little bit more welcoming. But I would definitively recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying for the location”
Reviews.Author: abenjamin9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has received very mixed reviews so wanted to be sure to leave a favorable review. Just spent five nights at lush hotel over the Easter period because all other hotels we tried to book we full. Most of what has been said is true, it is very loud all day long, particularly between midnight and early hours. We stayed on the fourth floor but could still hear traffic and people and noises from Taksim square. However the location is excellent and I am sure anything as close to the square would be loud. We booked the cheapest room available but am pretty sure we were upgraded because the room was spacious and the bathroom was big. I saw other rooms that were much smaller, basically a bed and a night stand but even those looked cute. The breakfast was standard, cereal cheese bread eggs, etc but also offered fresh squeezed juice everyone morning. The hotel staff were friendly and helped us book dinner reservations most nights. However we always had a specific place picked out, the few times we asked for suggestions they weren't overly helpful. The cleaning staff wasn't necessarily thorough but happy to oblige when we made a request (extra pillows, changing sheets mid stay). Overall I think this hotel deserves a positive review, they try hard and are incredibly hospitable and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: piyush69
Reviews.Content: Lush is a boutique hotel & as we wanted to stay in a boutique hotel we stayed there. It has trendy rooms & no two of them are same . Our room was nice & comfortable. The staff was helpful & courteous, they helped us a lot in planning our sightseeing in Istanbul. They have a very nicely designed cafe, the breakfast was good. Only the shower area in the toilet was too cramped up ,rest everything was comfortable. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly boutique-y hotel in a good 'hood but room sizes may surprise”
Reviews.Author: roughingit
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here after reading about it in the NY Times and seeing some "luscious" room photos on their fancy-shmancy web site. Each room was supposed to be unique and well, hiply designed and decorated. Upon arrival, location was excellent: a side street just 2 minutes from the central Taksim Square with subways and lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Greeting service, also excellent: the man at the desk took care of my bags, welcomed me in crisp English and offered me a drink and free access to a sauna-gym area. My rah-rah feeling was dashed, however, when I discovered my room was tiny: No more than a twin bed, a chair and a closet. Okay, I booked the cheapest room (junior at $128), but still it was smaller than a NYC studio. The best part was a hip-looking bathroom, nice soaps and amenities, and a full balcony. Breakfast was passable; not exciting, not bad. Over all, I'll say the service was very friendly, location superb, price, a bit high for what I got. When you book, be sure and ask for a larger room or try and specify which "type" of room you want (look at the web site for ideas).

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - STAY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: thomasj8529
Reviews.Content: Can't begin to understand why this place gets any kind of decent review. I have traveled the world, always staying in 3 or 4 star hotels - Lush is the worst place I've stayed in 10 years. Unkept rooms, poorly cleaned bathrooms (mildew), terrible noise from busy streets. Management is uninformed and pretty incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and nice”
Reviews.Author: atcmyers
Reviews.Content: what can I say, I liked it! It was quiet and comfortable. We had the largest room in the place even though we did not book it. Free upgrade. It is located about a half hour by transit from the "old" part of town. There were lots of good restaurants near the hotel and the area was very safe. The breakfast was good and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too cutsie”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel a lot and the location was superb. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable and I was able to use public transportation easily using their advice. The breakfast was good and the room was oddly shaped but comfortable. I think they try just a bit too hard to be "hip". There are a lot of eclectic items in both the public areas and in the rooms. The brochure actually has pictures and a write up one each of the hotel's rooms as though each is a special treasure. Maybe, but in a city such as Istanbul, with so much history and so many things to do, the hotel chochky rates pretty low. It was a fine choice but not for its 'hipness' but rather for its location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: sjbowman
Reviews.Content: While Lush Hotel was priced higher than other hotels in Taksim, my friends and I decided to splurge due to a favorable recommendation in the New York Times. We were very disappointed with the value. The water from the faucet on the first night was brown. We requested a third towel for our triple several times and ended up sharing for a night because our request went unanswered. The staff seemed reluctant to help us; for example, we asked the manager to help us make a dinner reservation at a restaurant, and he told us it was impossible and didn't try to call. These are just a few examples of why we found Lush Hotel overpriced. It would have been fine if our expectations were lower and we were paying less. The location is fantastic -- I'd stay at another hotel close by for less.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky rooms, puzzled service but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Playfairest
Reviews.Content: Staff were very nice but seemed puzzled about who these people in their hotel were - oh they're guests... Room 412 has to be recommended. The perfect antidote to big chain hotels. Stay there, be patient and smile. Yep rooms noisy but being that close to Taksim...no surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely hip and a great location”
Reviews.Author: LookingLooking
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here because of the reviews here on Trip Advisor. I am glad we did though. I don't really write reviews often but I thought I should provide a different experience to some of the other reviewers. I booked a few days prior via a travel website and paid 150 euro. We did get a really small room. They have a picture book of all the rooms at reception though, and when I asked if that was a very small room they said yes it was, but that it was a nice room and in a good location to avoid street noise. The friendly staff at reception said take a look and if we wanted to change, they could definitely do that. I guess if the room was more expensive I might have demanded more space but once I saw the room, I thought it was great. Very New York Loft style. Huge ceiling height and large windows which gave it a very airy feel. Having said that, the rooms that end in 03 seem to be the smallest, and those ending with 01 and 02 face the street. 503 is the only room on that floor so seems a little odd (the fitness centre and day spa area are on that floor). I think it was the fourth floor that had a lower ceiling than the others. So I'd imagine room 403 feels small and boxy, The staff really were all friendly though, and I am sure would tell you about the pros and cons of each available room when you book or check in. I really was amazed anyone would have a problem with the staff at this hotel. Maybe we were just lucky, or maybe they changed their staff. Or maybe it's a two-way street... just sayin... We asked for dinner recommendations; they gave us options, made the booking and gave us directions. It was a great restaurant with a lot of locals so we thought it was a great tip. The location really is second to none, a stone's throw from Taksim Square. So yes, there's noise at night. If you want an early night and no noise, maybe stay further out. Something like the Hilton would be much quieter (but not as interesting). We didn't hear any noise from the hallway though, only some outside noise. Again. maybe we were lucky. There is a great marble staircase that goes between floors but there's lots of beautiful and sound deadening drapes which seemed to take away any footsteps. It's not the smallest hotel gym I've seen, and the day spa area is nice and inviting. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, as was the rest of the hotel. I don't think the toiletries were anything special, but I did notice they had separate packages for men and women which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - small room and poorly maintained bathroom”
Reviews.Author: sydneyst
Reviews.Content: I booked Lush Hotel due to a recommendation from the NY times and from its impressive website. Our stay was disappointing. Firstly, the hotel room was very small - the website photos are deceiving. Secondly, the bathroom was very old and the shower drainage was clogged. I dont mind a small room, but the bathroom must be clean - it was not. The photos on the website are very deceiving. Thirdly, the room smelled of smoke. Fourthly, the bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were too flat. Fourthly, although a trivial matter, the hotel advertises L'Occitane bath products but the room only had bad quality products. Also, there was a lot of noise coming from the other rooms/corridors. The hotel concierge also recommended a few tours, which we took up, which were a total waste of time and money. Dont take the tours! On the plus side, location of the hotel is terrific and the breakfast is good. If I were to return here, I would not stay at Lush but another hotel in the Taksim Square region. Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Small but great hotel in a primo location in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: NickAgo
Reviews.Content: The prior reviews are a little unbelievable. While the hotel is small, the rooms are immaculate and very stylish. No "smell of sewage" and I haven't seen "peeling paint" everywhere. Trust me, I've stayed in some much worse hotels (see other reviews and picts). My take: positives- central location, well maintained and modern with good amenities, staff that are happy to help you, a small but workable fitness room, and (my pet peeve) FREE wireless internet!!! Negatives - the rooms are small and the fitness area is small, the reception seems a little disorganized, if nice. (Oh, I wouldn't take children here either - not conducive to little ones running about.) For the rate that we paid and the location, I would highly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? my [-]”
Reviews.Author: travellover131
Reviews.Content: I am an avid traveler in my late twenties. I am not fussy when it comes to hotels but one thing i cannot stand is dingy toilets and smelly rooms. I travel a lot for work and in my free time i travel a lot for leisure. I have traveled everywhere from Fiji to Alaska, from Mexico to Russia staying mainly at 3 and 4 star hotels. I have been deceived by booking hotels on the internet before but not like this. Please be warned! This hotel ruined my 'to be' fun exciting romantic first trip to Istanbul. This hotel is a scam! Extremely deceiving pictures! the rooms are way too small and dingy! the pictures on the websites are very deceiving. The hallways smell like sewage and the bathrooms are not clean! the paint is chipping off everywhere! I have pictures to prove it! Whoever rated this hotel a 4 star please have a look again!. I would give this hotel a 2 star rating at best. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location but then again there are much better hotels for a better price in the same vicinity. My advice to the owner: Spend less money on your website and spend more time for the upkeep of your rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Hip and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: mrmrsreis
Reviews.Content: A few days in Istanbul @ the Lush Hotel with my Mum and little brother who is 8 and from the moment the all black clothed young handsome young man opened he care door and showed us into the hotel I knew I was in for a surprise! I read a few bad reviews but I needed to judge for my self. From outside it doesn't look like a hotel ! its so discreet. Reception was like being at the museum so many interesting paintings and the furniture was exquisite it was also very laid back. Bedrooms were great ! Every rooms had a different design which makes this hotel truly unique. We stayed in a room 103 with 3 bunk beds which worked out perfect for us. Loved the bar/breakfast area - with giant plasma's in in mirrors. The Staff are so attentive, you only had to tell them once what you drank and from them on, as you would come to the end of your drink they would very knfdly ask you (would you like a refreshment sir) Breakfast was amazing, great food. Totally fell in love with this place and wouln't even think twice where to go again for something special. Most hip places are pretty snobish but this place is just right they cater for kids and were ever so friendly with my little brother. The gym and sauna is a must if you stay here because you will be putting on calories if your staying in Istanbul! I am a tripadvisor keeno and after looking at the top 10 hotels in istanbul Lush hotel deserves a place there. Shopping in Taxim is just a stone throw away makes this place ideal for a weekend getaway. Thanks again to the Staff at Lush for a wonderfull stay. Victoria, Fatma and Alican

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Aliicat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overpriced and very unpleasant experience. The only good thing about it was the location just near Taskim Square. Our first room aside from being unbelievable noisy could not be secured as the window was off the hinge and did not get fixed in the 3 days we were in the room. The bathroom had big chunk of marble out of the floor and mould growing in the sealant lien around the bathtub. When they finally moved us - the room was much nicer but the electrical cabling was dangerous. Plug in a electric cord and the power points detached showing blue arcing etc. The front desk staff are not helpful and I think the hotel likes to consider itself a trendy boutique hotel but falls far short of this and is way overpriced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Not hip or lush... rude and brash more like!”
Reviews.Author: sunandwanderlust
Reviews.Content: The hotel no doubt comes across as a hip and modern reprieve from the bustling city streets outside but that's where the positive aspects end. It is stinky, noisy, uncomfortable hotel with an incompetent staff. We were promised one price by a staff member and given an entirely new price, inflated price when it came time to check out. The Sales Manager refused to help in any way and the front desk guy was utterly rude and abrasive. They also do not tell clients when a big party is taking place in their bar downstairs, which means you will be listening to beats all night long whether you want to or not. Don't waste your vacation on this hovel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1Uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location close to Taksim square and ideally located for siteseeing. I stayed in a more expensive room it was huge! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a standard turkish breakfast, but staff always asked whether I wanted more food or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lush with 2 colleagues for 5 nights in November 2009. We decided to book it based on location, positive reviews and cost. We each did our research and booked the rooms of our choice. We really liked being able to see the rooms on the website. My colleagues each reserved a Deluxe room, 305 & 503. I opted to spend a little more and reserved 301 an Elegance room. Here's a brief description of each room. 305 - Negatives: Small. On the street and a bit noisy. Has the tinest shower. Positives: Has a small balcony. A double/queen bed. 503 - I didn't go in this room but based on my friend's comments...Negatives: Has 2 twin beds. Is the only room on the 5th floor along with the spa. Positives: On the side of the building so not as noisey as the street. 301- Lots of space. King bed. Jacuzzi tub w/ shower. On the back of the building so mostly quite (keep reading for more on noise). Negatives: None Each room has a mini fridge with, a surprisingly NOT exorbitant ,decent selection of drinks and snacks and room for you to add a few things. A kettle and complimentary coffee/tea. Hair dryer. The windows open. Wireless internet and breakfast are included. There are very few tv channels in English. However, the manager told us they are working on that and should have a better selection of television in lots of languages in a few months. The location is good, just off Taksim Square. And the location can be loud! Request a room on the back of the building. My room (301) was very quite...... until Saturday night.....we were all awake until after 4am. There is i lift, but it is so small, it only fits 2 people. We used the Lush Transfer service and it was terrific both ways. The breakfast was adequate. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. We were quite happy with the location (except for Sat night). You can walk to lots. Istiklal Street is a block away. Its a pedestrian street lined with shops and restaurants. It gets quite crowded at night but is great to have so near by. The best restaurants are on the side streets off Istiklal. You can take public transportation from Taksim Square. There is a really good, casual restaurant, with amazing views across the street next to the Belgium Embassy. I think its called the Beer House (Beer is definitely in the name) Good food, good price. Restaurant is on the second floor and the back wall is all glass with views of the water. We went back there several times. So....all in all, we enjoyed staying at the Lush and probably will again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidHector
Reviews.Content: Enter the hotel and it feels like leaving Istanbul and arriving at an arty boutique hotel in Berlin or New York. Modern, chic, friendly staff dressed in casual but elegant clothes. Giant photo murals of the city, antique style furniture, a fun eclectic mix. The hotel brochure includes pictures of all the rooms, none of which are the same. A couple of complimentary glasses of chardonnay (or anything else you fancy) arrive seconds after you have installed yourself in your room. There are little "His" and "Hers" boxes in the bathroom - toothpaste, shave foam, condoms etc. Room service was quick to replace the "Hers" with another "His" when they realised we were a gay male couple - no problem. Their IT manager spent ages struggling with my laptop, when it had a little problem and could not get the free wi-fi connection - no charge. Little downsides: 1.We were in one of the hotel's smaller rooms - wouldn't have been great for more than one night (there are bigger rooms). 2. Great breakfast, but horrible coffee - they should explore other brands. Big plus - turn right out of the hotel and soon you're in wonderful Cihangir. Restaurants, cafÃ©s, small designery shops, elegant apartment buildings. A joy. We live in the south of Turkey. Our next weekend in Istanbul will be spent at Lush - in one of the bigger rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: rac1975India
Reviews.Content: I came away with the satisfaction that I'd made the right decision. Since we were travelling with parents, I had to ensure the hotel/ room was absolutely clean, comfortable and conveniently located. After exploring atleast a 100 hotels (and trust me I am not exaggerating...I have spent days planning this trip), I came across a NY Times review of Lush. Lush met all my requirements to the T. Yes, the junior/ deluxe rooms are small - but they have all you need and when you are only going back to the hotel to sleep and have breakfast and at the most take a short break - it really didnt matter. What was important was that the rooms were nice to look at, the sheets and toilets were absolutely clean and that we were well looked after. I was most pleasantly surprised by how helpful the staff was - whether it was guiding us on what to do, where to go, how to get there - or whether it was trying to procure a medicine late at night on a sunday - they were just awesome! Kudos to the staff for that. the breakfast spread was decent enough. All in all - came away with the feeling that this was good VFM..not something we feel often these days. The location is perfect!!!!! We couldnt have asked for anything closer to Taksim square, the metro, the cab stand, the bus stop etc etc etc...all just a 2 minute walk away

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Cathns
Reviews.Content: I can understand the mixed reviews of this hotel. It is indeed hip, but a bit ratty around the edges and with one of the smallest rooms Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Our first night we stayed in a room with a connecting door and could hear everything the people next door were saying â€“ this was tolerable early in the evening, but not so much when we were woken up by a drunken fight at 4am. The next morning we tried to upgrade to a larger room but the hotel was full â€“ front desk staff were very helpful moving us to another room which, although also small, was at least much quieter. On the plus side, breakfast was good, and the hotel was very close to Taksim Square and all of the bars and cafes (although we werenâ€™t as enamoured of Istanbul as others - Taksim was a bit too similar to Oxford St for our liking). Lush is a good hotel, but not great, especially in light of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Neither lush nor hip”
Reviews.Author: starflyergold
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neither lush nor hip. I stayed three nights at the LUSH hotel in a so called â€œelegance roomâ€� (102). Check in was conducted in a messy room which served as reception (cluttered by boxes, magazines and generally unappealing). The room I was given was a mid size sparsely furnished room with wooden floors, washable paint walls and devoid of any character. It featured an ok bed, a mirror placed against the wall (not hung) a tiny desk (not suitable for working) and a side table. Not even an armchair to relax in, it was either the bed or the chair for the desk. Very uncomfortable. The bathroom was so small that even the proverbial cat would not have fitted in, the grouting of the shower discoloured and stocked with simple toiletries which did not get replaced on the second day. The TV only featured Turkish stations with the exception of one German TV station but even there the reception was fickle. The mini bar was just a fridge on the floor and again was not being refilled, neither was the coffee for the kettle. Overall very poor service and a poor room. The service was mediocre. The guy at reception was yelling at the bell boy when I needed a taxi, not a nice sight. The breakfast was served in the gym as the ground floor which I assume normally holds the bar/bistro was a construction site (noise and dirt to go with it). The staff at the breakfast were the only ones that were consistently friendly. While my room was to the back (with a view of a messy courtyard), the noise from other rooms and the hall could be heard loud and clear. They charged me â‚¬ 239 for this room per night which was about â‚¬ 150 too much and clearly a rip off. This hotel tries to be a boutique hotel but has none of the wow factors or amenities to go with a boutique hotel. Service (housekeeping) is poor and furniture throughout looks like it has been rescued from a skip. WiFi was free but again a hit and miss. I am at a complete loss when I read some of the glowing reviews here and wonder if the reviewers actually stayed at the same hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: GotWineWillTravel
Reviews.Content: We, two 30 year old single women, stayed at Lush for 3 nights in July 2009. The staff was very accomodating and the room was very well appointed. I believe it was Rm. 301. Our room was great because it was in the back of the hotel, so we didn't get the street noise at night. Lush is very well located and is in walking distance to the busy shopping streets as well as the train system to take you to the historic parts of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld1983
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in the Lush Hip Hotel for 4 days and loved it! The standard double rooms are a bit small but the weather was rainy and cold and just added to the coziness of the place, the little balconies meant you could stand out over the street and feel the vibe. They are located on the modern side of Istanbul so the area was buzzing and full of bars and clubs in the surrounding area. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended and booked restaurants for us which were lovely and which without their help we would never have found. The breakfast spread each morning was everything you could think of. We could not rate this place any better.

Reviews.Title: “Lush Hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: cpietz
Reviews.Content: Lush Hotel was perfect! Would highly recommend staying there if views from your room are not important to you. It's located one block from Taksim square, very convenient to access all of Istanbul's public transportation. It's also very close to Istiklal Caddesi, the main walking street which has tons of restaurants, bars, shopping, cafes, etc. I stayed in room 301 which was quiet, beautiful and very spacious (compared to other hotels in Istanbul). I hear the rooms facing the front of the hotel are more noisy. I think it's worth the extra money to splurge for an "elegance" room in this hotel as I think the others are pretty small. Most of the hotel staff was helpful when we had questions on transportation, things to do etc. They served a traditional breakfast Turkish breakfast which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel, close to Taksin Square, VERY quiet”
Reviews.Author: tomToronto_CANADA
Reviews.Content: Lush Hip Hotel is in a renovated building 1 minute away from Taksin Square. However it is far removed from the noise and traffic of the area, so it is incredibly quiet, No 2 rooms are the same which makes the Lush unique. Parking is TYL20 per day. Very unusual set up - there is no conventional reception area - only a small desk with 1 person working at it, so i was thrown off for a minute looking for a standard reception counter. Standard rooms were at Euro 109= TYL 160, which for Istanbul is on the higher side, but hotel availability in the Beyoglu area is more limited and the standards are higher.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: msbovary
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-July after traveling through the Greek Islands for 3 weeks and this hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. It's very trendy and fashionably decorated - definitely has the feel of a high-class boutique hotel. The staff were very nice - upon checking in, one of the men from the front desk took us up to our room and showed us how to work the A/C, the TV (which has satellite and lots of channels) as well as the lighting in the room which is controlled by a remote (great little extra feature). Furthermore, they have laptops with wireless internet that guests can use for free, and you can even take it up to your room and bring it back whenever you are done with it. Our room was just a regular, basic suite but was still so nice: the bedding was AMAZING - super soft and high quality duvet with heavenly pillows; great flat screen TV with lots of channels; fabulous bathroom and shower with complimentary toilettry kits for men and women which included razors, toothbrushes and toothpaste, shower caps, Q-Tips, a sewing kit, etc. And at this hotel, breakfast is included in the price of the rooms which was quite impressive - a huge buffet of delicious fruits, croissants, yogurts, honey, cereals, granola, toast, etc. We had read some negative reviews of the breakfast at this hotel but I honestly have no idea how anyone could have NOT liked the breakfast served at Lush. Even the service at the complimentary breakfast was fantastic - someone would come as soon as you sat down to ask if you wanted freshly squeezed orange juice, coffee, or even omelettes if you preferred something more than what was at the buffet. Also, we read negative reviews about this hotel in terms of it being "noisy" and too loud for some people to sleep - again, I have no idea what these people were talking about as we did not find it to be noisy at all. I consider myself to be a very light sleeper and I can tell you that not once was I woken up in the night by noise from the street at this hotel. Some other reviews had described the hotel as being right on Taksim Square (which is very loud and bustling and always full of people), but it's definitely NOT - it's set back from the square by about a 3-5 minute walk which is perfect because you're still close to the square, but far enough away from it that the noise isn't an issue at all. Don't be fooled by reviews saying this hotel is in a noisy location - it's not, and that's coming from someone who is very easily woken up at night. Also, some reviews noted that this hotel isn't in the main tourist districts of Istanbul and that's absolutely true. However, this was one of the main things we LOVED about this hotel. You're not in the middle of all the cheesy tourist stuff and the massive crowds that surround the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc. and personally, I really liked that. The area that Lush Hotel is in is on the other side of the river so walking to all the main tourist sites is not an option - however, it's extremely easy and cheap to get to via the furnicular and then the tram (both run really frequently). Plus the tram takes you across the river so you get a beautiful view of the city each time you venture into the touristy part of town. The area that Lush is in is more authentic in terms of being less touristy, and is also really close to some super-trendy districts that we walked to each night and had a blast in. For example, the restaurant/bar 360 which is one of the most talked-about and trendiest restaurants in Istanbul is about a 10 minute walk from Lush. Plus there's the most fantastic shopping stretch like 2 minutes from the hotel which I spent an entire afternoon wandering - really, really great shopping! The other great thing about this hotel is that the shuttle bus from the Airport drops you off at Taksim Square which, as I mentioned, is a less than 5 minute walk from Lush. So we literally hopped on the bus at the airport, got off at Taksim, and then walked the short distance to our hotel which was great. No taxis, no subway...just a quick walk. This was also really helpful when we left and had to catch the shuttle bus early in the morning. Overall, this hotel is fantastic and gives great value for its money. It's unique and has personality, on top of feeling luxurious and very fun and trendy. I would definitely recommend it and I would stay there again if I'm ever back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: MrFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at one of the Junior rooms and the decor was just like on the picture. The staff is very friendly and speak good English but the gym is just a small room of the last floor to with a little equipment only. This hotel is in an excellent location, if you like busy lively neighborhoods. Taksim is crowded most of the day and till late at night with shopping venues and restaurants. The hotel is also very close to the metro station which makes it very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: SRC16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for four nights and was very pleased with what I got. having read the reviews on here I was expecting a nice hotel in the centre of the city and that's exackly what I got. The hotel and rooms are all very pleasently presented, the decor is of a very modern and high standard, the staff are all very freindly and helpful and cannot assist you enough. the only complaint I have is that the hotel bar is very expensive which kind of lets the hotel down a little as the bar tself is a very nice area where you wouldn't mind sitting a chilling out but at around Â£6.50 for a small glass ofe wine is very over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool place but still not there yet”
Reviews.Author: lolo0610
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lush for 4 nights last week. We went for it after reading of it's fantastic location and the fact that it is not a branded hotel but more of a boutique hotel. First impressions of the outside of the hotel and the entrance were positive. It's really a "hip place". However the welcoming we received from the staff was nothing but hip. I don't think we even got a customary "welcome to Istanbul". We checked in and were taken to our room. It was small unlike the ones we saw online and were a little bit disappointed but overall it was a nice bright and light room. We went for the deluxe room so perhaps we should have opted for the super deluxe instead. The shower in our room was really great as the shower head was huge. The toilet was a child's toilet but it did not bother us as we are not super tall but I suppose it would bother people above 1.80. Our bed was the biggest let down. It was as hard as concrete. We spent the majority of our 4 nights there tossing and turning. A comfy bed is a must in any hotels and this was really not up to any standards. The bed frame was also small and would not fit people of 1.75 which is pretty bad! The overall look of the hotel is great, very hip and modern and the decor throughout is very well thought through.
