Apart from the bed the other main fault of this hotel is its staff. They are not a welcoming bunch and they don't go out of their way to make you feel special in any way. I would avoid the breakfast unless you just ignore the staff and don't order tea or coffee. I once spent 30 minutes sitting at the bar waiting for a cappuccino that never arrived and when I asked where it was they laughed. Well that is not the kind of service I would have expected from this hotel. The best part of this hotel is its central location. You really can explore all of Istanbul from here and be in a hip and upcoming part of town at the same time. The value for money is great too as for hotels so centrally located you normally end up paying for it whether this one was reasonable. I think if they can work on their customer services, advertise all of their available rooms (deluxe and super deluxe) so that you donâ€™t feel disappointed and change the mattress in some of the deluxe rooms this hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lush? Hip? Yep, a good name!”
Reviews.Author: pxyzyzygy
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this funky little place not far from Istanbul's Taksim square, in the hip and happening part of town, BeyoÄŸlu, and I have to say, it was one of the nicer places we've stayed in. We were in a comfy, quirkily decorated (part clean smooth lines, part rococo!) room, with a big bouncy bed and a powerful shower you could get a football team into. We ate dinner there on our first night in town, and it was absolutely gorgeous, though by no means cheap, and the quality of the brekkies for the rest of the week didn't disappoint at all. The staff were sweethearts, helpful and friendly (free English language newspapers and Wifi! Excellent!), the cocktails were amazing, and the corridor to our room (number 418), was one of the most bonkers ones I've ever been on, all weird blue lights and big b&w photos of the town laminated onto the doors. Heartily recomended. Word of warning; This is a noisy part of town, with car horns and partying people making plenty of racket till well after midnight, so bring earplugs, even if you're up on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “clean,friendly staff,dynamic area-love it”
Reviews.Author: Omania
Reviews.Content: Staff were welcoming, since we stayed in sultanahmet 1st we left our passports in the bags,the staff said first go to ur room and then come down again to fill the forms,,very helpful and friendly! the rooms are exactly the way they look in their site. you can ask for a particular room and u'll get it (we did), good aircon, hip furniture,small but stylish clean bathroom. the hotel is two mins walk from the very active lively street of istiklal, 4 mins walk from the metro that takes u to levent shopping area and other tourist areas, nice breakfast. i advise room 402. liked everything abt it

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsiliAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights to a "Superior" class room, as I have seen from other reviews that normal rooms are rather small. The room was spacious with a really big bed, nice furniture and a design touch. The shower was small, but OK. The hotel is very near Taksim square and the staff was friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is rather noisy, but you are in the city very center after all. Breakfast could be better, but is the average one expects from such places. Given the low season price we paid, it was a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem! Boutique style for the young global nomad.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem! If you like trendy boutique style for rather affordable price, Lush is one of the best I've stayed at worldwide. Top marks for the modern lofty boutique-hotel in the center of the action of Istanbul! Rooms: Very high-cielings, large room, quality hardwood floors, exposed brick walls, large modern high-end bathroom, enormous bed, giant plasma TV with many channels. Well soundproofed and powerful air-conditioning. I would select this as a studio apartment over my current apartment, if it had a corner kitchen! Very nice. Location: Near the pedestrianed shopping streets near Taksim Square. Thousands of shops, restaurants, bars and great transportation. (Metro stop on the square. Buses and taxis to everywhere. Havas buses to the airport depart from the other side of Taksim square, a short 5-10min walk.) Staff: Professional and attractive. Gave us advice on nightlife. (and what a suprisingly good city for nightlife!) Breakfast: Good breakfast until late morning.

Reviews.Title: “Potential for a future classic”
Reviews.Author: DarkAmber
Reviews.Content: Lush has the potential to be a great hotel in every city guide. As it is, it's good and I have been back already. The location is very good for shopping and nightlife, and also for walking tours of the city. The building is just the sort of building that should be converted into a hotel - quirky, characterful, historic. You have a real sense of arrival in Istanbul with just enough feel of indulgence. The rooms are a great eclectic mix of furniture and objects: I hope they continue to add to the rooms and keep building on the experience and upgrade some of the cheaper items (beds? comfy, but just a bit 'new' to the eye?). Taksim is a busy place and the original windows don't keep out all the sounds of the city - but that's part of the price of a building like this. I found the staff charming and helpful - they remembered me 6 months later and gave me the room I'd had before. The restaurant is a fantastic space and could be a real fixture on the circuit: however my food experiences there have been disappointing: the breakfast is poor to be honest - expectations are high in a hotel of this position and it's this aspect that let's the place down: but remember - I have been back since: so I have forgiven Lush because I enjoyed everything else so much. Also - in the evening - one of Istanbul's finest restaurants (Changa) is on the other side of the street. I'm sure I'll be back again: I want to see good evolve into great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Simlatrk
Reviews.Content: I can say it has been one of the best experience I had; there is indeed not a single point to complain. The Hotel is a boutique one which is nicely decorated and the rooms especially decorated in different styles. I had the chance to experience two different rooms, "112" which was very romantic and "301" a comfortable and elegant one. Ä°t is only 1 minute away from the Taksim Square which is a plus. The meal was real delicious. We had the chance to listen Paul Dwyer live in the evening at the Lush Restaurant which was an amazing experience. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They did not put us in hurry to c heck out at 12:00 exactly, we checked out at 13:00 and that was no problem. In that case having red the reviews telling that late c.out caused problems, I am really surprised because; every single travelling person knows that there is fact called "c.out time" and if there is something extraordinary you ask the reception and if there is availability they let you c.out a bit late..but this time shouldnt be extended for hours and missuse the sypmathy of the Hotel..otherwise this would be arrogance I believe..I certainly recomend this Hotel for the people who have real taste..

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Central”
Reviews.Author: adywads
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night on business, but I found my stay pleasant and problem free. Due to the fantastic location and stylish boutique nature of the hotel I would definitely recommend to friends and colleagues. I also found staff to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Chic comfotable hotel in the heart of Istabul”
Reviews.Author: FazednBemused
Reviews.Content: Great small boutique hotel minutes away from Taksim square and numerous shops and restaurants. My room was tastefully decorated with all the right toys to make your stay comfortable. Attentive staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough to help you. Handy tip is to get them to book your taxi's for you, slightly less chance of going on a special tour of the city if you do! It's a small hotel so only has a small restaurant and bar but it is quite adequate. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Romain__Paris
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 4 days decoration is perfect! The staff was very friendly and the room was very well-designed you feel like at home. The spa massage was super. And the housekeeping works very well. Actually i was wondering dont they use bed sheets again cause that seems like that :) absolutely recommend everyone who wants to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Should I learn to speak turkish?”
Reviews.Author: Marcelinha
Reviews.Content: I chose the Lush Hotel trough the internet, after viewing a few pictures at Booking.com website. I got in touch directly with the property and bought a 3-night package with room, transfers and half-day city tour for 600 euros. The problem began when we arrived, very late at noght and there was nobody waiting for us at the airport. After 30 minutes seraching, I called the hotel and found out the trasfer-guy was picking up 2 people, so my name was written (wrong) in the back of the paper - I would never find him. We ended up arriving at the hotel at almost midnight. By the way, I almost died intoxicated in the way, because the guy from the transfer probably didnt take a shower is the whole week before, cause he stinked like a dead rat. The location is great, just one and a half block from Istiklal, the main peddestrian street (where you can find lots of nice occidental stores, like Diesel). You can walk day and night without problems (also to go to bars in the Nevizade region) and there are lots of public transportation just two blocks away, in the Taskim Square (buses and subways are the best options, taxis always cheat on tourists and charge three or four times the original price). The room was very nice, spacious, very cool decor, nice bed and bathroom. The breakfast was ok also, although too simple for a 4 star hotel, and so did the tour, too superficial, but ok. The biggest problem in the hotel is the service, because almost nobody speaks a good english in the hotel, except a guy who stays in the day and - the most funny part- the guy who takes care of the breakfast. The guy who stays at night is terrible!!! He pretends he understands what we say and gives absurd answers!!! I asked one day how long the tour would take and he answered me is costed 50 euros. The other day I asked him the adress of a restaurant and he said me, in these words: "you turn the first left, walk 200 meters and ASK AGAIN. ItÂ´s a very known restaurant, anyone will show you".Is it possible that someone from a hotel answers you that? We finally found the restaurant one hour later (and it was 1,5 km away, not 200 meters) and they required reservations. Shouldnt the guy told me that, if he probably knew, since itÂ´s a famous place? Another day, I asked the girl from the reception (there is only ONE person at the reception at a time, so you have no one else to ask) how I could get to Sultanahmet (the old and touristic part) by public transportation and she said me she didnt knew, that she never went there by bus. Since itÂ´s the most visited place in her city and she works in the front desk at a hotel, shoudnÂ´t she know? Or at least try to inform herself to help me, since almost nobody speaks english in the streets? Our stay, even with the very nice location, cool room and very nice and modern decor, was a catastrophe and we will not stay there again or recomend the hotel. Ah, I was almost forgetting: our transfer back to the airport arrived at the hotel only 35 minutes late than the scheduled time. We almost lost the check in.

Reviews.Title: “not 4* hotel,services low for price payed”
Reviews.Author: daliana_t
Reviews.Content: In my country this would have been cathegorized as a 2+ star hotel(the rooms are very small altough there nice furnished,clean and the staff is helpfull;even an amatour that doesn`t know 2 much about renovating can see that the hotel has just been given "a look" and not proper renovated.As you go in the hotel, you are easely hit by a smell of mould combined with parfume....a smell present in all the hotel!!The breakfast buffet is not so impresing either...the food is all cold and meat products don`t taste as they should....they taste as cheap salami full of chemicals.In my last day off sitting in the hotel i whent shopping and i was a bit late to make the rooms reception,but i didn`t think it would be a problem because when i left the hotel in the morning i asked the receptionist to send someone and do it("No problem" he said).At 2 a clock in the afternoon as soon as i stepped in the front office,the same receptionist ,started to shout at me as if i was inferior to him and not the hotel`s client(4 * in Turkey) and to point me to the clock asking"what time is it?Do you know when the reception should have been done?you are not in Romania here!!!......and i was like ...what!??!?!!....(.as far as i know my country is a member of E.U, while Turkey is a loooong wayyy from being received in E.U...look whose talking)."Because you were not here i evacuated your room(me and my sister-2 women) and your baggages are under the stairs,your friend`s room(a man) i could not evacuate because there were things scatered all over the room..."i had to sell the room".I got very mad,because neither he ,nor the hotel personell had any right to touch my things ,yet alone to putt in bags some of the things i specially left on the bed to take with me on the plane.I felt my right to intimacy was brutally violated!!! I whent upstairs with a hotel staff member to check the minibar.We first entered the room were our friend stayed and the receptionist said there were things scatered....Surprise!!...His room was clean and his bag was made ,nothing scatered ...exactly like he told me in the morning when we left to go shopping.Furious i got out of the room and went to the room me and my sister stayed in.I knocked on the door,to see if the room was really occupied by someone else like the receptionist sayd...Surprise again..Behing me quickly came the guy who checked the minibar and opened the door to check my minibar 2.I entered and i was shocked!!Not even the bed sheets were changed,a can of cola opened i left on the table was still there...so he had to throw out of the room my bags because other clients had to stay there,but no sight of new clients,not even the room cleaned...2 houers after my bags were evacuated..hmmmm..It was just the receptionists who felt he was powerfull enaugh to do as he pleases or maybe he was just a [--] misogynist.So we made a scandal he won`t forget any time soon.He wanted to force us to pay another half day for 2 cameras and showed me a invoice(computer writen by him :))))..My country has many defects and services not always good,but this has NEVER happened to me back home and also, invoices are writen on special papers marked by the national government and in 2 copies, not by the emiter in Word =)). All this time he was shouting at us;we tryed to calm him but nothing,he wouldn`t even let us speeck....so i took the invoice and made it pieces in front of him...he HIT me with his hands when he pulled what was left of the invoice out of my heands...I asked the nr of customer protection in Turkey but of course i did not get it....it did not matter that they are force by law to give it to you if you ask for it. All of this was happening at my expence because in one houer my plane was taking off.Extremely mad, because me,nothing else than a woman permited herself to speeck to him like that....offended to his heart,he called the police...that wasn`t a problem,i was glad he did it because i knew he wasn`t wright and would have been no problem for me to press charges for violation of privacy,violent language and behavior and also for them to pay my flight tickets ....when he heard this he calmed....1500Euro comming out of his pocket was not such a bright image for him.So we left! Now i want to contact customer protection in Turkey and i am not going to stop untill my story will be read by everyone.In the end ...this made a beautifull weekend into a terriblle experience and changed my opinion about this country 360 degrees...they like to call themselves europeans that have no prejudices,a free country very far from the near and extreme orient`s sphere.The lack of education and there barbarian history is very present!
